thread.title: Ground News - Safe Haven Baby Boxes blesses 112th box in Indiana, 191st overall
thread.title_full: Ground News - Safe Haven Baby Boxes blesses 112th box in Indiana, 191st overall

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Safe Haven Baby Boxes blesses 112th box in Indiana, 191st overall
text:
Summary by Ground News Baby boxes are safe incubators that have alarm systems, so 911 is notified as soon as a baby is placed inside. Infants surrendered under Indiana's Safe Haven Law are placed in the custody of the state's Department of Child Services. The process then begins to find an adoptive family within 30-45 days. Share menu More

WRTV Center High Factuality Corporation: E. W. Scripps Company Safe Haven Baby Boxes blesses 112th box in Indiana, 191st overall LAWRENCE Safe Haven Baby Boxes blessed their 191st total location on Thursday and 112th location in Indiana on Thursday. Located at the Lawrence Fire Department in the 4400 block of McCoy Street in Lawrence, the baby box provides new parents another option.
